We‚Äôre looking for an Senior Applied Data Scientist who expects more from their career. Joining our advanced data science team, you‚Äôll investigate, develop, implement and deploy a range of complex applications and components while working alongside super-smart colleagues challenging and rewriting the rules, not just following them.

What you'll be doing:
‚Ä¢ Using cutting-edge data science and machine learning methodologies to tackle complex business problems and deliver insights that resonate with our clients.

What we expect from you

What you can expect from us

We won‚Äôt just meet your expectations. We‚Äôll defy them. So you‚Äôll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you‚Äôd expect from a leading technology company. But also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not expect. Plus, thoughtful perks, like flexible working hours and your birthday off.

You‚Äôll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. But with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and learn.

At dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work.

Svitla Systems Inc. is looking for a Principal Data Scientist and AI Engineer for a full-time position (40 hours per week) in Chile. Headquartered in California, the company‚Äôs mission is to enhance supply chain resilience, sustainability, and operational efficiency for manufacturers and enterprises across various sectors, including food, beauty, consumer packaged goods, electronics, aerospace, and construction. The platform includes a digital twin engine that simulates both routine operations and shock scenarios (such as supply chain disruptions, commodity price spikes, and geopolitical events), allowing businesses to proactively test and compare the impact of different decisions on key business outcomes. The solution integrates hundreds of external signals, including macroeconomic, industry-specific, and market data, into its models, enriching AI-driven recommendations with real-world context. The AI agents continuously learn from historical and real-time data, generating alternative scenarios for demand planning, production scheduling, procurement, and logistics. The platform is delivered as a cloud-based, subscription service, with modular adoption for specific use cases (e.g., demand planning, production planning). It integrates via APIs with ERP systems, including SAP, Oracle, and Microsoft Dynamics.

We are seeking highly innovative and energetic principal data scientists with experience in developing enterprise-scale deep learning, forecasting, and decision-making models, who have a strong algorithmic background.

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of deep reinforcement learning (DRL).
‚Ä¢ Understanding building large-scale models with reinforcement learning, LSTMs, CNNs, GANs, and gradient boosting.
‚Ä¢ Experience deploying end-to-end ML models to production.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of time-series data analysis.
‚Ä¢ Significant experience in time-series modeling.
‚Ä¢ An excellent problem solver who is both methodical and creative. You can learn any new technology, are not ashamed of admitting errors, love to take on new challenges, and are a great team player.

Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Design, implement, and optimize advanced machine learning models, including deep learning architectures, to solve complex business problems.

‚Ä¢ Work closely with the team to align model development with business objectives.

job_title: Data Scientist IV ‚Äì UF Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI)
job_description:
JOB NO:

524887

WORK TYPE:

Staff Full-Time

LOCATION:

Lake

CATEGORIES:

Allied Health, Grant or Research Administration, Health Care Administration/Support

DEPARTMENT:

29680302 - MD-CTSI-VILLAGES HEALTH CRC

CLASSIFICATION TITLE:

Data Scientist IV

JOB DESCRIPTION:

The UF Health - Precision Health Research Center (PHRC) located in The Villages, FL, hosted within the Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI) seeks an enthusiastic and qualified individual to fill the Data Scientist IV position. This position will work with the PHRC Director as part of the leadership team to develop, implement, and coordinate data management in translational and implementation science research projects aimed at improving health care quality, outcomes and well-being for older adults.

The Data Scientist IV at the PHRC will be responsible for selecting and applying appropriate analytical methods to answer questions and test hypotheses as specified by clinical researchers, administrators and clinicians. This position will require expertise in both database design and complex statistical methods and algorithms. Expected projects will include design of research and operational databases and statistical analyses, and development of reporting infrastructures. Providing leadership to domain experts on issues related to principles of data science and analytical methods. Prioritizing and coordinating multiple tasks so as to achieve tight deadlines (as determined by commitments to funding agencies), and complying in a timely manner with administrative requests and requirements.

More About This Role

Data Processing Analytics

This position will utilize data science and statistical software such as Python, R, and SAS, to analyze and interpret research data. This position will also use other database/analytical software platforms (e.g., MSSQL) to develop queries and manipulate data for deployment to real-time systems used in data activities. Expertise will be necessary to design and develop scripts to transform data from multiple data sources into primary data collection centers and make the data analytical-ready. Additional expertise in software such as RedCap and databases will be important for success. Knowledge and expertise will be needed in integrating, filtering and extracting multivariate and multimodal clinical databases for patient cohorts of interest from local databases and data warehouses.

Administration of Projects

This position will be responsible for formulating procedures for effective administration of research projects and protection of health information in accordance with University policy, and all applicable state and federal laws. This position will also be responsible for ensuring quality, consistency and validity of large multimodal datasets.

Writing Reports of Analyses

This position will assist in the interpretation of data and compile reports of analyses to inform data system planning. This position will also be responsible for maintaining data infrastructure capable of supporting analyses of clinical research data. This position will also be responsible for summarizing and visualizing results for inclusion in specific publications.

Who We Are

The University of Florida‚Äôs Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI) was established in 2008 to accelerate the translation of scientific discoveries into improved health outcomes. As a university-wide research infrastructure, the CTSI enhances UF‚Äôs capacity to conduct impactful clinical and translational research by offering resources, training, and support to investigators across disciplines. The institute promotes collaboration among researchers, clinicians, and community partners to advance scientific innovation, improve health care delivery, and address health disparities throughout Florida and beyond.

EXPECTED SALARY:

$97,000-$110,000; Commensurate with education and experience.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

A doctorate in a related field with two years of relevant experience in data science, statistics, bioinformatics, analytics, or similar field. A Master's degree with three to five years of relevant experience.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

EXPERIENCE
‚Ä¢ Must demonstrate experience with database design, reporting tools, and project management and familiarity with health care information system industry.
‚Ä¢ Working in healthcare or academic research environments
‚Ä¢ A customer-service orientation and/or experience working with older adults
‚Ä¢ Committed to participant protection and privacy

KNOWLEDGE
‚Ä¢ Must demonstrate experience with EMRs (such as Epic), systems, and data design.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of RedCap
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of SQL or other relational database management systems
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of basic principles of clinical research.

SKILLS
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with general statistical software (e.g. SAS, R)
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with machine learning frameworks (R, Python, Weka, RapidMiner, etc)
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Microsoft Office Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, and data analysis software (Excel, SPSS)
‚Ä¢ Excellent technical writing and communication skills

ABILITIES
‚Ä¢ Ability to plan, organize and coordinate work assignments.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work effectively and independently.
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.
‚Ä¢ Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.

OTHER QUALIFICATIONS
‚Ä¢ Creativity
‚Ä¢ Attention to detail
‚Ä¢ Professionalism
‚Ä¢ Good judgment

SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS TO APPLICANTS:

In order to be considered, you must upload your cover letter and resume.

The University of Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

This is a time limited position.

This requisition has been reposted. Previous applicants are still under consideration and need not apply.

Application must be submitted by 11:55 p.m. (ET) of the posting end date.

No

Eastern Daylight Time

job_title: Fresh Graduated - Python Developer for AI Technologies
job_description:
Job Description

About the product: Adaptive Bug Search (ABS) is a machine learning-based service that is used to identify similar and/or duplicate bugs. ABS uses deep learning techniques to improve the accuracy of the ABS bug predictions. ABS autoruns on over 400 BugDB products. This translates to 30% of all bugs filed in Oracle and correctly identifies duplicate bugs with 70% accuracy. ABS results are integrated into BugDB, MOS, JIRA, and Cloud OPS UI.

About us: Our group in Mexico currently consists of about 25+ industry-leading developers who participate across multiple products. We partner with our development team in US and India. As a member of the software engineering division at Oracle you will participate in all phases of software product definition, development and ongoing enhancement and support.

Career Level - IC2

Responsibilities

As a member of this team, you will assist in defining and developing software for tasks associated with the developing, debugging and designing of software applications or operating systems. Provide technical leadership to other software developers. Specify, design, and implement modest changes to existing software architecture to meet changing needs.

What you will need to apply:
‚Ä¢ Only fresh graduated engineers (between June 2024 and Jun 2025).
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, applied math or related field, also MS/PhD are welcome.
‚Ä¢ English is a must have, excellent written and oral communication skills.
‚Ä¢ Relocation to Guadalajara for non-local candidates. Come to live the Oracle MDC experience, one of the best facilities to incubate your potential!

What you will do:
‚Ä¢ Improve the accuracy of existing algorithms to an acceptable level.
‚Ä¢ Broaden existing algorithms to work well with various Oracle products.
‚Ä¢ Improve the run-time of existing algorithms.
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain necessary infrastructure to run and maintain the algorithms.
‚Ä¢ Develop a feedback system to improve the selection of features for the algorithms.

Technical Skills you will bring:
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with algorithms and data structures.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with coding in Python.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with basic database schema management and operation.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with code development in PL/SQL, C, C++, Java, Perl (at least 1).
‚Ä¢ Experience working with Cloud services, or building your own server (Personal cloud, automation, ‚Äúhomelabing‚Äù, Linux, containerized VMs, Networking) is a bug plus.
‚Ä¢ CI/CD & DevOps Tools: Familiarity with Git, Jenkins, Terraform, and other DevOps practices for infrastructure as code.
‚Ä¢ Networking & Security: Understanding of networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, DNS, firewalls, VPNs) and cybersecurity best practices.
‚Ä¢ At least 1 years of previous experience working on IT roles / internships.
‚Ä¢ ICPC Participation is a big plus.

What we will provide:
‚Ä¢ Competitive salary with exciting benefits.
‚Ä¢ Constant training so you are ready to make an impact.
‚Ä¢ Flexible and hybrid work for the ideal work-life balance.
‚Ä¢ Exposure to all the latest technology tools so you can find your calling.
‚Ä¢ Freedom to define your professional aspirations and choose your own path.
‚Ä¢ Self-paced learning, access to Oracle Certification Platform and courses that will help you advance your career journey.
‚Ä¢ An open culture that champions what makes you unique.

A career at Oracle is defined by you. We give you the freedom and skills to write your own success story. No matter what path you choose, you will gain invaluable learning experiences and receive support to become your best self.

Oracle is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Description - Senior Python Agent Engineer

Suplari, a leader in collaborative and autonomous AI Agents for finance and procurement professionals, is seeking an experienced and product-centric senior Python Agent Engineer to work across our Engineering and Customer Success teams. The right candidate is passionate about delivering innovative solutions to business customers.

In this role, you will design, build, and implement scalable, secure, and innovative AI-driven solutions by collaborating with Engineers, customers, and CSMs. You will design and own the data pipelines and data access mechanisms that power our agentic solutions. The right candidate is creative, self-motivated, experienced at applying an agile-mindset, and has a track record of working with disparate and complex data to enable the application of AI in software systems.

At Suplari, customers are at the focus of what we do. We are a small but mighty team with a growing portfolio of some of the world‚Äôs most recognizable brands. Help us continue to build a game-changing product, a robust business, and a set of highly successful customers.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Apply your years of experience in Python to deliver data-driven capability to customers and to automate and streamline all data flows across our solution, from customer source systems to agent-based end user analytics
‚Ä¢ Implement feature extraction, transformations, and normalization processes as a part of our software engineering and data science team
‚Ä¢ Deliver compelling new services that extend Agent capabilities and value
‚Ä¢ Ensure the security, integrity, and privacy of all data used within Suplari
‚Ä¢ Apply ML Ops and prompt engineering in Generative AI / retrieval augmented generation patterns
‚Ä¢ Implement agents and tooling using agent frameworks like LangGraph and OpenAI APIs
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with customer success managers, product managers, software engineers, data scientists, and other members of the team to deliver impactful solutions
‚Ä¢ Evaluate technologies and design patterns we can adopt so as to improve the Suplari offerings
‚Ä¢ Consult and assist with automating solutions for enterprise customer operational requirements around data handling
‚Ä¢ Be an active member of our team, bringing a growth mindset, customer orientation, and a bias for automation

Position Requirements
‚Ä¢ 6+ years experience with Python developing product solutions in a commercial SaaS environment
‚Ä¢ Skilled in frameworks such as Pandas and Jupyter Notebooks
‚Ä¢ 4+ years experience with Databricks
‚Ä¢ 2+ years experience working with the large commercial foundation models
‚Ä¢ Strong AWS experience, including RDS, PostgreSQL, Dynamo, Elastic Search, Spark, and more
‚Ä¢ Experience working with data scientists, ML pipelines, LLMs, and prompt engineering
‚Ä¢ Experience working with large, semi-structured datasets like legal documents, application logs and financial transactions
‚Ä¢ Comfortable with CI/CD utilizing Terraform, Docker, and Jenkins
‚Ä¢ Experience working with and building RESTful web services
‚Ä¢ Apply world class product delivery principles, from automated testing to CI/CD to security, monitoring, and telemetry
‚Ä¢ Bachelor or Masters degree in computer science or equivalent technical area

Location

Suplari is headquartered in the United States and operates there and in Mexico as Suplari MX. We support a hybrid remote workplace. The rhythm of the company operates in the Pacific timezone. Candidates outside of this timezone will be expected to collaborate within it.

Suplari is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_title: Python Engineer, Alpha Gen Technology, Mexico City
job_description:
About This Role

PYTHON ENGINEER ‚Äì MEXICO CITY

Are you interested in building innovative technology that shapes the financial markets? Do you like working at the speed of a startup, but want to solve some of the world‚Äôs most complex problems? Do you want to work with, and learn from, hands-on leaders in technology and finance?

At BlackRock, we are looking for Software Engineers who like to innovate and solve complex problems. We recognize that strength comes from diversity, and will embrace your unique skills, curiosity, drive, and passion while giving you the opportunity to grow technically and as an individual.

With over USD $15 trillion of assets, we have an exceptional responsibility: our technology empowers millions of investors to save for retirement, pay for college, buy a home and improve their financial wellbeing.

Being a developer at BlackRock means you get the best of both worlds: working for one of the most advanced financial companies and being part of a software development team responsible for next generation technology and solutions.

What is AlphaGen Technology (AGT)?

The Alpha Gen Technology group (AGT) is a function within Aladdin Engineering that enables BlackRock investment teams to deliver market leading performance (alpha) to their clients.

We work with investment researchers to develop predictive signals and strategies that are traded on BlackRock hedge funds and other active portfolios. The services we provide range from: quantitative library development, model engineering, alpha product development and investment technology R&D.

You will join an interdisciplinary team, building software for market prediction, used in BlackRock‚Äôs powerful asset management platform: Aladdin. We are a diverse and distributed group of experts in software development, Quant and Data engineering from Belgrade, Budapest, Gurgaon, London, Mexico City, Mumbai, New York, and San Francisco. If you‚Äôre interested in working with a global and diverse group of engineers and partner teams to thoughtfully craft solutions at scale with impact across the BlackRock and Aladdin investment research space, apply!

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ You will be working with elite investment professionals to build cutting-edge, high quality alpha signals and platform. Depending on your interest and the role this may include:
‚Ä¢ Work with Researchers and Portfolio Managers to implement trading signals and models used for making investment decisions
‚Ä¢ Identify and utilize new alpha-enabling technology in signal implementation
‚Ä¢ Developing APIs based on microservices architecture built on cloud native architecture stack.
‚Ä¢ Identifying and prototyping new alpha-enabling technology.
‚Ä¢ Partnering with other engineering and partner teams at BlackRock to integrate with Aladdin.
‚Ä¢ Identify and implement ways to improve the efficiency of our system
‚Ä¢ Work in close collaboration with both our Product Managers and Portfolio Managers to support and evolve our production products and processes

Qualifications

We value post-graduate degree holders, and we also value individuals with equivalent commercial experience. If you have a good mix of the skills below, we would love to hear from you!

You Have
‚Ä¢ BA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
‚Ä¢ At least 2+ years‚Äô experience working in data analytics environments
‚Ä¢ 2+ years experience in Python
‚Ä¢ Experience with dev ops tools like Git, Maven, or Azure DevOps
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills
‚Ä¢ Passion for learning and implementing new technologies
‚Ä¢ Ability to operate under fast-paced environment

Skills That Would Be a Plus
‚Ä¢ 2+ years experience in Java, SQL, and Cloud technologies including S3, Kubernetes, AzureML, and Dask / Airflow
‚Ä¢ Ability to apply mathematics, machine learning or quantitative analysis to solve sophisticated problems and deliver innovative solutions with a keen attention to detail
‚Ä¢ Exposure to developing REST APIs
‚Ä¢ Experience / Familiarity with databases and cloud data platforms such as Snowflake, Databricks etc..
‚Ä¢ Exposure to NoSQL platforms
‚Ä¢ Container-Orchestration technologies like Kubernetes
‚Ä¢ Experience working on a globally distributed team

What will you learn on the job?
‚Ä¢ A good understanding of quantitative investment strategies, risk, equity, fixed income, or financial derivatives
‚Ä¢ Build a platform that enables large scale analytics and data science workflows
‚Ä¢ How to apply machine learning and data science technology to alpha generation
‚Ä¢ Aladdin - the investment platform which manage over $15 Trillion of the global assets.
‚Ä¢ Exposure to large universe of datasets and deal with some of the most exciting data & analytics challenges

Our Benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

Our hybrid work model

BlackRock‚Äôs hybrid work model is designed to enable a culture of collaboration and apprenticeship that enriches the experience of our employees, while supporting flexibility for all. Employees are currently required to work at least 4 days in the office per week, with the flexibility to work from home 1 day a week. Some business groups may require more time in the office due to their roles and responsibilities. We remain focused on increasing the impactful moments that arise when we work together in person ‚Äì aligned with our commitment to performance and innovation. As a new joiner, you can count on this hybrid model to accelerate your learning and onboarding experience here at BlackRock.

About BlackRock

At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children‚Äôs educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.

This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment ‚Äì the one we make in our employees. It‚Äôs why we‚Äôre dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.

For additional information on BlackRock, please visit @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock

BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.

BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.
